node.display_long_description:
Synth Riders is a freestyle dancing VR rhythm alternative. Lose yourself in the incredible music, ride the unique rail system, meet friends in the multiplayer, and get a good workout in the process!

• Dance to 59 Songs (49 OST and 10 DLC)
• Enjoy Official Custom Song Support

• Meet up to 10 Friends in Cross-Platform Multiplayer
• NEW! Have Great Laughs with Multiplayer "Power-Ups"
• Experience 90°, 180°, and 360° "Spin Mode" in Every Song

• Burn Those Calories with a Fitness Tracker
• Take Part in Exciting Weekly Challenges
• Play with Friends and Family in "Party Mode"

Enhanced graphics and 90hz on Oculus Quest 2!

“An amazing physical experience with a workout that involves the entire body.” -VR Fitness Insider

“Synth Riders offers an excellent, freestyling alternative to other VR rhythm games.” -Android Central

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
This release contains a number of small fixes following on from the Multiplayer Power-Ups release.

MULTIPLAYER / POWER-UPS
- Players will now see the "Synchronising Players" message while in Immersive Mode
- Shield no longer appears under clear platforms in custom stages (PCVR)
- Settings > Multiplayer > Power-ups > Show Usernames allows you to control whether you receive messages on send, receive, both - or to turn off messages entirely
- Player names longer than 15 characters will be shortened on send/receive messages
- Bug-fixes: Improvements to fix push to talk problems within rooms
- Bug-fixes: Prevent multiplayer sound equalizer out of bounds errors
- Internal changes: Localization of attack send/receive messages

TWITCH INTEGRATION
- New command added, !set allmodifiers true/false to allow the player to enable and disable the effects all at once.
- The !rainbow command is no longer disabled while prismatic modifier is enabled.  Instead, it has the same "toggle" behaviour as the power-up and will stop score uploads
- Bug fix: Moderators were not able to use modifier commands when disabled, even with the moderatorcommands permission
- Bug fix: When a song was requested, if you were looking at the custom songs list, it would reset the list when a song was requested (thanks Xrayxout & Raptor)
- Internal changes: Preparation for localization and improved configuration will cause in-game twitch settings to be reset for everyone
OTHER BUG FIXES & IMPROVEMENTS
- Fix for some custom songs giving missing notes.
- (Quest) Audio Latency Calibration menu is working correctly again.

As always we welcome your feedback and bug reports on our Official discord server (Invite: http://discord.synthridersvr.com). Please use #bugs-report to make sure that we see your feedback.

If you want to support the development of Synth Riders, we really appreciate reviews left on the Steam/Oculus Store!

node.display_short_description: The “Cyberpunk Essentials” music pack takes you to the future with all 5 paid Cyberpunk songs + "Dystopia" stage!

node.name: "Synthwave Essentials 2" Release Party With the Devs!

nodes.title: Power-Ups Multiplayer Update is Here!
nodes.body_text:
Dear Riders,

We are thrilled to present Power-Ups, a Kart Racer-style collection of boosts and attacks that you can pick up and use in the Multiplayer to turn the tide of the battle!

The Power-Ups arsenal comes with two boosts (Shield and Score multiplier) and seven attacks, such as “Embiggen” that will turn the notes into beach balls, “Warp” that will make them approach at an impossible speed, and "Invaders” that will hover over the stage and try to hit you with their projectiles. And yes, the power-ups can totally stack up for the craziest combinations!

Check out the Power-Ups trailer on YouTube.

We wish you many great laughs and unforgettable moments playing Synth Riders multiplayer with your friends and family. Power-Ups put smiles on many faces during the beta testing and we are delighted to finally share them with all of you!

You are invited to join the Synth Riders Community on Discord and leave a review on the Oculus Store to support the development.

See you in the Multiplayer!

nodes.title: Track your fitness in Synth Riders
nodes.body_text:
Dear Riders,

We’re seeing more and more of you turn to VR to stay active while at home.

Oculus Move is a new platform feature that helps you track your calories burned and physically active minutes you play any game or app, including Synth Riders. Set goals, check your progress and have fun while you work out.

The Oculus team let us know that they’re rolling Oculus Move out gradually, so some Quest and Quest 2 users will have access to this platform feature starting today.

Find Oculus Move in your library!

node.reviewDescription:
Ok, this is going to be a hard review to write.

I came across this game at the start of the c19 pandemic, figured I'd give it a go, see how the competition in rhythm games was doing, not expecting much honestly.

I figured with my BeatSaber Expert-ise, should be no problem at all to jump right in to the hard levels... Well, I was a bit right and a lot wrong. 

This game has way more range than BeatSab. What do I mean? Well at expert+ in BeatSab, consider it might break your wrist :) but in Synth Riders, at Master level, it might break your whole arm! I mean this in the best possible way, BeatSaber was how I got my workout on, Synth beats it by a mile as far as that goes, it's got me running a darn workout class *every* weekday* morning* in multiplayer (come check it out!)

So, the moves you have to make are just so, so, so much more expansive, the coordination of your whole body is so much more complex and rewarding,  the game modes are so much more varied, I mean have your seen spin mode? It's not even a competition, synth wins in every respect here.

Then there's multiplayer. It's been around since early 2020, it's created hands down the best, most welcoming, most inclusive community I've ever seen for any game ever. Come in to synth Saturday, 9pm eastern, or Synth Sunday, late afternoons eastern, and experience for yourself such a warm and happy crew, who just love to welcome newbs into the fold, because they know what your journey is going to be, and that once you synth, you won't want to stop :D

I've lost count of the number of times I've had a multiplayer room open and a fresh beat saber refugee comes in and gushingly tells me about what an incredibly better game this is. 

Fabulous ost, fabulous music packs, easy customs, it's all there. 

Come, join us! I'm HeavyGee - and I am a Synth Rider.
node.reviewTitle: "I can't go back", that's how I feel now
